contents.Pharming: Social engineering attack that RELIES on a SMB visiting a fake banking website
contents.Pretext: Creating the fake backstory for a social engineering attack
contents.Watering Hole Attack: Is an infected, live website rather than a clone of a website
contents.Polymorphic Infections: Evade detection by traditional AV products
contents.Do FIRST after ransomware recovery: Perform regular, daily testing of FULL BACKUPS
contents.Trjoans: Malware disguised by or hidden in seemingly harmless software
contents.Internet Forum: for the exam indicates a XXS attack on a compromised web site
contents.TAXII: A threat-feed client-server architecture supporting STIX format
contents.STIX: A shared threat intelligence format for IoC's
contents.End of Life: Segment the asset off the network that can connect to the internet
contents.Intrusive Scan: run the exploits on the target system
contents.Non-intrusive Scan: stop short of running the exploits on the target system
contents.Tokenization: process of subsituting sensitive data like credit cards. The token has no exploitable value
contents.Transit Gateway: A way of connecting multiple VPC's
contents.Data Sovereignty: Must adhere to regional data handling laws
contents.Out of Band: Sharing a symmetric encryption key using a method separate from the communication data being sent
contents.Elasticity/Scalability: The ability to ramp up and down based on load or need
contents.Redundancy: Fault tolerance provided by high availability (HA)
contents.Mantraps: May also be called an Access Control Vestibule
contents.Perfect Forward Secrecy: Ensures all previously encrypted data remains secure if a key is compromised

contents.ARP: Address Resolution Protocol - a set of network addressing tables
contents.PUP: Potentially Unwanted Program - slows computer down noticably
contents.CSRF: Cross Site Request Forgery - plain text token
contents.XSRF: Cross Site Request Forgery - encrypted token
contents.IV: Initialization Vector - when used in context of cryptography
contents.WPA - TKIP: WiFi Protected Access - Transient Key Integrity Protocol
contents.WPA3 - SAE: WPA version 3 - Simultaneous Authentication of Equals
contents.CAM: Content Allocation Memory table - a switch table
contents.MSSP: Managed Security Services Provider - security focussed
contents.WAF: Web Application Firewall - a.k.a. Reverse Proxy
contents.FIM: File Integrity Management - A tool to compare changes to file hashes
contents.CYOD: Choose Your Own Device - company provided device list
